author: Animalogic
description:
Has one of the greatest debates in herpetology been settled? For decades, Komodo dragons were thought to kill using bacteria-laden saliva, but new research is showing that the y actually have a sophisticated venom system. How did they manage to keep their weapon hidden for so long? And what does it mean for all the monitor lizards around the world?

If you’d like to see a Komodo Dragon in the wild check out: 
https://www.komodoislandtour.com/ 
https://www.scubadivekomodo.com/

Learn more about our expert's work here:
Dr. Aaron Leblanc - https://www.kcl.ac.uk/people/aaron-leblanc
Professor Bryan Fry - https://www.venomdoc.com/

00:00 Komodo Tricked Scientists for Decades
01:18 Just how big can a Komodo get?
02:33 The bite that cuts like iron
04:09 Other animals with iron in their teeth
05:27 Venom and the myth of the dirty mouth
06:27 How venom boosts hunting success
07:19 Komodos as super predators
09:03 Forked tongues and the Jacobson’s organ
10:05 When did we start calling them drag
title: Komodo Tricked Scientists for Decades
